questions.question: In what year did Catiline run for consul, in spite of rumours of rumours about assassinations and plots swirling?
What was Catiline's threat, issued on Cicero challenging him about the rumours?
options: Two bodies: one wasted with a head (Senate) the other strong but with no head (People) he intends to lead the second body
A sword for each of his enemies

questions.question: Of which group did Catiline present himself as a leader?
What did Cicero do when overseeing the elections for the consuls of 62?
options: Wore a breastplate and had a bodyguard around him.
Stood before the Senate with a sword
Called for a military presence in the forum

questions.question: Was Catiline successful in his bid for the consulship?
options: He was elected consul for life
He was appointed consul but later removed

questions.question: Upon hearing the results of the election, what did Catiline send Manlius away to do?
What was Cicero warned of by letters he subsequently received 18/19 October?
In light of this, and reports of a gathering army, what did the senate do?
options: Offer a pardon to the rebels
Send a peace delegation to Catiline

questions.question: When he received reports of Manlius gathering troops at Faesulae what did Cicero do?
How was Cicero warned of a plot to assassinate him?
options: Through a letter from the Senate
By one of the conspirators' mistresses

questions.question: What did Cicero do in response to this failed assassination?
options: Ordered the arrest of all conspirators

questions.question: What was Catiline's response to these speeches?
options: He fled Rome to Join Manlius

questions.question: What groups does Cicero say were among Catiline's army?
What does Catiline's letter to Catulus tell us of his motivations?
options: It was due to being robbed of what he deserved that he rose up, selfishness of others.
He wanted to create a just and fair government
He wanted power for the plebs
He was influenced by foreign powers

questions.question: What did the conspirators then try to do which resulted in some of them being unmasked?
options: Recruit a Gallic tribe to their cause
Plan an assassination attempt on Cicero

questions.question: In the debate on the conspirators' arrest, who proposed they should not be executed?
Whose speech, in favour of execution, swayed the senate to ultimately vote for death?
What happened to Catiline and his army after the execution of the conspirators in Rome?
options: Support fell away, and they were defeated early next year
They were reinforced by foreign soldiers
